job_title: Department Administrator in New York, NY
pros: Healthcare is paid for through the company, paid leave, vacation time starting immediately, and a merger with a larger, Jewish university gives us all Jewish holidays off. Most all of the staff and faculty are kind.
cons: Somewhat demanding role, requiring employees to arrive early or stay late with little notice. Pay is not consistent across departments for the same position. Issues with diversity. Management (specifically higher-ups) cater to the students and do not support their staff/faculty nearly as much or enough.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Coworkers where a pleasure to work with.  Always willing to help.
cons: Upper management were stuck in there ways and never wanted to try any new procedures or ideas.  They seem afraid of change.

pros: None. The admissions management to terrible!
cons: The admissions  management is very poor and out of control. The manager is very insecure person who doesn't like people who do their work very well. Very high turn over rate because of this.

job_title: Assistant Director of Enrollment Management in New York, NY
cons: Not worth it in the end

pros: Openness to ideas and change, support of colleagues and leadership, alignment between personal and school mission. Healthy and growing school.
cons: Season of transition, room for growth in communication practices. New leadership at various levels means many things are in process. Overall anticipate positive growth and opportunity to contribute.

job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Portland, OR
pros: Kind, supportive, and welcoming staff with a focus on serving the unique student body. Leadership that genuinely appreciates their employees and gives them room to improve existing processes. Working at Western is a once-in-a-lifetime experience! The campus is beautiful and well landscaped and a short distance from SE Hawthorne and Mt. Tabor park.
cons: Small campus that doesn't offer all the amenities that you may expect working at a college. Administration is housed in a beautiful older home so space is limited as are electrical outlets. Western uses an in house created management software which is a headache and a half!
A lot of changes in a short period of time.

pros: Good place for students to learn about religion
Everyone you meet loves Jesus and wants to advance his Kingdom. The staff is united in purpose and full of grace.
cons: I wish it could last forever.
